DataElement.preferredName: HIV Status Database Case Report Form Completed Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine if the electronic document designed to record result of testing to determine if an individual is infected with the human immunodeficiency virus has been completed within a database.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: HIV Status Database Case Report Form Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The result of testing to determine if an individual is infected with the human immunodeficiency virus._An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing._A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The result of testing to determine if an individual is infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.

Concepts.definition: The result of testing to determine if an individual is infected with the human immunodeficiency virus.

Property.preferredDefinition: An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing.:A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing.
A printed, optical, or electronic document designed to record all of the clinical study-required information stipulated in the protocol to be reported to the sponsor on each clinical trial subject.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
